description: Galle and Bentota Day-Tour From Colombo
include: Hotel pickup and drop-off in a shared vehicle
exclude: Madu River boat safari ($30 for solo travelers, $25 per person if 2 or more travelers)

experience.heading: Pickup Location Options
experience.text: Colombo , Negombo, Dehiwala, Mount Laviniya, Wadduwa, Kalutara

experience.heading: Galle Fort
experience.text: Photo stop, Visit, Free time, Sightseeing, Walk, Sunset, Self-guided tour, Pass by (1 hour)

experience.heading: Arrive back at
experience.text: Colombo, Negombo, Wadduwa, kalutara, Dehiwala, Mount Laviniya

fullDescriptionParas: After being picked up at your hotel, hop onboard your Madu Ganga Magrove boat safari and explore the Madu River. See the mangrove forests and marshlands that surround the river. Stop at a cinnamon garden, and try some of the areaâ€™s famous cinnamon. The Madu Ganga River region is home to some of the best quality cinnamon in the world as well as a flourishing cinnamon industry. Afterward, marvel at the fishermen who stoically sit atop large branches planted in the middle of the water waiting for their catch.

Continue to a local Turtle Hatchery, where your guide will introduce you to the many local varieties of turtles. End your tour with a visit to the Galle Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. This fort illustrates the unique interaction of European architecture and South Asian traditions from the 16th to the 19th centuries. After discovering the fort, you will be returned to your hotel in Colombo

description: From Colombo : Day Trip to Kandy | Pinnwala | Royal Gardens
include: Complimentary pickup and drop-off ( Colombo, Dehiwala, Kadawatha, Gampaha, Kandy )
Travel comfortably in a luxury, air-conditioned car
exclude: Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic (about 6 $)
places: Temple of the Tooth in Kandy
fullDescriptionParas: Experience the vibrant culture and natural beauty of Sri Lanka on this captivating tour from Colombo to Kandy. Your journey begins with a visit to the Pinnawala Elephant Orphanage, where you can observe and interact with orphaned elephants as they bathe and play in the river. This heartwarming experience offers a glimpse into the conservation efforts dedicated to protecting these magnificent creatures

Continue to the Temple of the Tooth in Kandy, a sacred Buddhist site that houses the relic of the tooth of the Buddha. Marvel at the intricate architecture and experience the spiritual atmosphere of this revered temple.

Next, immerse yourself in the tranquility of the Royal Botanical Gardens in Peradeniya. Explore the vast collection of plants, including orchids, palms, and medicinal plants, while enjoying the peaceful ambiance of this botanical paradise.

Afterwards, embark on a spice walk in Kandy, where you'll learn about the spices that are integral to Sri Lankan cuisine. Engage your senses as you smell and taste a variety of spices, gaining insight into their flavors and uses.
Conclude your tour with a visit to a tea factory, where you'll learn about the process of tea production from leaf to cup. Discover the art of tea making and sample some of the finest Ceylon tea

Finally, make your way to Kandy View Point, where you'll be rewarded with panoramic views of the city and its picturesque surroundings. Capture the breathtaking scenery and create lasting memories of your journey through Sri Lanka.
The tour will conclude with drop-off at the same location in Colombo where you were picked up.

description: From Colombo : Sigiriya and Dambulla Day Trip and Safari
include: Guide Assistance in Sigiriya Lion Rock (English, German, French, Spanish)
exclude: Optional National Park Jeep safari (1 person $ 100/02 person or more $50 per person)

experience.heading: Dambulla Royal Cave Temple and Golden Temple
experience.text: Visit, Sightseeing, Walk, Self-guided tour (1 hour)

fullDescriptionParas: Depart Colombo and travel by a shared vehicle, in a small group, to the city of Sigiriya, and head directly to Sigiriya Rock on arrival. Gaze in awe at the massive column of rock that, according to the ancient Sri Lankan chronicle The Culavamsa, was selected by King Kassyapa as the site of his new capital.

Admire numerous paintings of historic queens, princesses, and maids inside the rock fortress before getting a break for lunch at your own expense. Then, explore some of the traditional crafts of the region, such as wood carving and batik textiles, with time to purchase souvenirs before departing.

Start the journey back towards Colombo via Dambulla to explore the largest and best-preserved cave temple complex in Sri Lanka. Discover the magnificent Buddha images and rock paintings of vivid colors and different shapes, painted from around the 2nd century B.C. up to the 18th-century Kandyan era
Optionally Can be done the Wild Life Safari at Eco Park or Kaudulla National Park or Minneriya National park charges for National Park very on Pax Count ( For solo Passengers $ 100 & $ 60 )

description: From Colombo : Galle and Bentota Day Tour
include: Hotel pickup and drop-off in Colombo, Dehiwala, Mount Lavinia, Kalutara,Bentota, Beruwala, Kosgoda, Ahungalla, and Balapitiya area
exclude: Madu river boat safari (Solo traveler is 30 USD per person. Two or more travellers are 25 USD per person)
Turtle Hatchery Ticket (15 USD per person)
fullDescriptionParas: Start your day with a convenient pickup from your hotel. Hop aboard your comfortable tour vehicle and experience the wonders of Sri Lanka's Madu Ganga River Region with a thrilling boat safari. Witness the beauty of mangrove forests and marshlands as you sail through the Madu River. Discover the secrets of cinnamon at a local garden and taste the renowned spice.
Be captivated by skilled fishermen perched on branches, patiently waiting for their catch. At the Turtle Hatchery, meet various turtle species and learn about their conservation efforts.

The tour concludes with a visit to the UNESCO-listed Galle Fort, a remarkable blend of European and South Asian architecture spanning centuries. After this unforgettable journey, you'll be safely returned to your Colombo hotel. Don't miss this opportunity to immerse yourself in nature, culture, and history.

description: From Colombo | Negambo : Sigiriya, Dambulla and Minneriya Day Trip
include: Air-conditioned Vehicle with English Speaking Driver
Parking fees and other transport-related expenses
exclude: Entry ticket to all places and activities

experience.heading: Pickup Location Options
experience.text: Colombo, Negombo, Dehiwala, Mount Laviniya , Wennapuwa

experience.heading: Dambulla Royal Cave Temple and Golden Temple
Arrive back at:
experience.text: Colombo, Negombo, Dehiwala, Mount Laviniya , Wennapuwa

fullDescriptionParas: Explore the Sigiriya Lion Rock Fortress and Minneriya National Park on a day trip from Colombo. Visit the Hiriwadunna Village and enjoy a Sri Lankan buffet, take a jeep safari in Minneriya National Park, and visit the Dambulla Cave Temple.

Start your day with a visit to the Sigiriya Lion Rock Fortress, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and the 8th Wonder of the World. Climb to the top of the rock and admire the panoramic views of the surrounding area

Next, visit the Hiriwadunna Village and enjoy a Sri Lankan buffet. Take a village safari, starting with a bull cart ride, then go to the lake for a catamaran ride, and finally go to a village home. Enjoy a Sri Lankan rice and curry meal with a small cookery demonstration.
After lunch, head to Minneriya National Park for a 4-hour jeep safari. See herds of elephants as they walk 35 km every day. During the season, visit the Hurulu Eco Park near Minneriya.
On your way back to Colombo, stop at the historical Dambulla Cave Temple and Golden Temple.

description: Colombo: Galle and Bentota Day Trip From Colombo City
include: Visit to a local Turtle Hatchery
fullDescriptionParas: Discover the Madu Ganga River on a boat safari from Colombo. See the mangrove forests and marshlands that surround the river. Stop at a cinnamon garden, and try some of the areaâ€™s famous cinnamon. Visit a local turtle hatchery and the Galle Fort.

After being picked up at your hotel, hop onboard your Madu Ganga Magrove boat safari and explore the Madu River. See the mangrove forests and marshlands that surround the river. Stop at a cinnamon garden, and try some of the areaâ€™s famous cinnamon. The Madu Ganga River region is home to some of the best quality cinnamon in the world as well as a flourishing cinnamon industry.

Afterward, marvel at the fishermen who stoically sit atop large branches planted in the middle of the water waiting for their catch. Continue to a local Turtle Hatchery, where your guide will introduce you to the many local varieties of turtles.

End your tour with a visit to the Galle Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. This fort illustrates the unique interaction of European architecture and South Asian traditions from the 16th to the 19th centuries. After discovering the fort, you will be returned to your hotel in Colombo.

Start your 6-hour city tour of Colombo with a visit to the famous Bandaranaike Memorial International Conference Hall (BMICH), which is renowned for its opulent architecture. Explore Independence Square, a representation of Sri Lankan independence, next.

After learning about the island's lengthy history at the Colombo Museum, visit Gangarama Temple, a tranquil oasis in the middle of the busy city. The Lotus Tower, which provides sweeping city views, is not to be missed.
Discover the colorful mayhem of Pettah Market and neighborhood bazaarsâ€”a sensory extravaganza. Admire the magnificent Fort Railway Station and the historic Colombo Lighthouse.

Galle Face Green is a waterfront promenade that's ideal for relaxing. Following lunch, continue your journey with stops at Ponambalam Vaneswarar Temple and St. Anthony's Shrine, both of which provide insightful looks into local culture.
Enjoy the memories as your tour comes to an end and you are driven back to your hotel, enhanced by the beauty and diversity of Colombo.

description: Colombo Private Day Tour and shopping
include: Parking Fees and other transport related expenses
exclude: Any Other Services Not Specified Above

experience.heading: Starting location
experience.text: Colombo, Mirissa, Negombo, Induruwa, Unawatuna, Marawila, Galle, Weligama, Bentota, Ahungalla, Wadduwa, Kalutara, Kandy, Kosgoda, Ambalangoda, Hikkaduwa

experience.heading: Arrive back at:
experience.text: Marawila, Induruwa, Kalutara, Galle, Wadduwa, Ahungalla, Weligama, Bentota, Kosgoda, Unawatuna, Colombo, Negombo, Kandy, Mirissa, Ambalangoda, Hikkaduwa

places: Old Parliment Building and Colombo Lighthouse
fullDescriptionParas: The Colombo one-day city tour offers a captivating glimpse into the vibrant capital of Sri Lanka, blending modernity with a rich historical and cultural tapestry. A bustling metropolis situated on the west coast of the island, Colombo is a fascinating mix of colonial charm, contemporary architecture, and lively local markets.

Begin your day at Independence Square, a symbolic location that commemorates Sri Lanka's independence from British rule in 1948. The picturesque square features a monument and a surrounding park, providing a serene start to your exploration.

Next, head to the National Museum of Colombo, where you can delve into the island's history. The museum houses a diverse collection, including artifacts from ancient kingdoms, traditional art, and exhibits on Sri Lanka's colonial past.

Venture to Gangaramaya Temple, a prominent Buddhist temple that seamlessly integrates various architectural styles. The temple complex includes a museum, a library, and a sacred Bodhi tree, making it a spiritual and cultural hub.

In the afternoon, immerse yourself in the vibrant chaos of Pettah Market. This bustling commercial area is a labyrinth of narrow streets filled with shops selling spices, textiles, jewelry, and an array of other goods. It's a sensory delight, and bargaining is a common practice.

Explore the architectural beauty of the Old Parliament Building, a colonial-era structure with neoclassical influences. Adjacent to it stands the Colombo Lighthouse, offering a panoramic view of the city and the Indian Ocean.

Lotus Tower is a prominent architectural landmark located in Colombo, the capital city of Sri Lanka. Also known as the Nelum Kuluna in Sinhala, the Lotus Tower stands as one of the tallest structures in South Asia and serves various purposes, including telecommunications, observation, and tourism.

Embarking on a shopping tour in Colombo, the vibrant capital city of Sri Lanka, is an exciting and rewarding experience. Colombo, with its blend of modernity and tradition, offers a diverse range of shopping opportunities that cater to various tastes and preferences. Whether you're seeking traditional handicrafts, high-end fashion, or unique souvenirs, Colombo has it all.According to this part visit textile shop, hand craft shop, gem and jewelry

description: From Negombo: Southern Coast Highlights Private Day Tour
include: Entrance fee to Kosgoda Turtle Hatchery
Transport throughout the tour with an air-conditioned vehicle
1 liter of bottled mineral water per person

experience.heading: Kosgoda Turtle Conservation and Research Centre

fullDescriptionParas: Start your day tour with pickup from your hotel in Negombo at 6:30 AM. The first stop on your tour itinerary will be the Handunugoda Tea Factory which you will reach at approximately 9:30 AM. The Handunugoda Tea Factory reawakened the ancient Chinese tradition of creating Virgin White Tea, which is untouched by human hands during the manufacturing process. During the one-and-a-half-hour tour of the factory, see how this mysterious process takes place to create one of the top luxury teas in the world.

Travel next to Ahangama to meet the stilt fishermen, who are one of the most iconic figures of Sri Lanka. Learn how they practice this unique and intricate fishing technique from a local practitioner of this ancient tradition.

At approximately 12:00 PM you will stop for a lunch at your own expense in a place of your choosing, before reaching Galle at 2:00 PM. This coastal city has withstood three foreign invasions; during which time, it grew from a bustling port which was the main stop for ships travelling east, to a fortified and yet beautiful city with many monuments which have withstood the ravages of time. See the Galle Fort which is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, the Galle Lighthouse, the National Maritime Museum, the picturesque cobblestoned streets, and many more colonial remnants.

Leave Galle at 3:30 PM to visit the Kosgoda Turtle Hatchery, a journey that takes approximately 1 hour. Learn about the 5 types of sea turtles that visit Sri Lanka for nesting, and how the nests are protected. You will be able to see and touch baby turtles and view some of the fully-grown turtles that are treated for injuries and ailments. Return to your hotel by 8:30 PM to complete the excursion.

fullDescriptionParas: Begin with a visit to the iconic Sigiriya Lion Rock, soaking in its historical charm at sunrise. Dive into village life in Habarana, experiencing traditional Sri Lankan cooking

Continue the journey with a thrilling four-hour jeep safari at either Minneriya or Hurulu Eco National Park, home to South Asia's largest elephant gathering and diverse wildlife. On the way back to Negombo, visit the Dambulla Cave Temple for a cultural touch.

Wrap up your day with memories of ancient Sigiriya, village warmth, and wildlife encounters. Join us for a professionally curated adventure, seamlessly blending culture and nature for a day to remember.

description: Colombo & Negombo To Galle | Hikkaduwa | Mirissa Day Tour
exclude: Entry/Admission - Kosgoda Sea Turtle Conservation Project
Entry/Admission - Sea Turtle Farm Galle Mahamodara

experience.heading: Madu Ganga
experience.text: Guided tour, Sightseeing, Scenic views on the way (1 hour)

experience.heading: Unawatuna Beach
experience.text: Break time, Lunch, Free time (1 hour)

fullDescriptionParas: The itinerary begins with a visit to Galle Fort, where guests can walk along the historic walls and take memorable photos with guidance from their tour guide. The next stop is the Madu Ganga Biodiversity Area in Balapitiya, offering an exciting mangrove boat safari. During this trip, visitors can enjoy a fish foot massage and observe various wildlife such as crocodiles, large lizards, and numerous bird species.

The tour continues to the Kosgoda Sea Turtle Conservation Project, where participants can learn about and witness the conservation efforts for sea turtles. Here, the team cares for the eggs and young turtles for up to five years before releasing them back into the wild. Afterward, lunch is served at a highly-rated beachside restaurant on Unawatuna Beach, where visitors can also enjoy a relaxing walk along the coast.

Following lunch, the tour heads back to Galle Fort to visit the iconic lighthouse and take more photographs. Another unique experience is offered at Koggala, where guests can try stilt fishing, a traditional method of fishing in Sri Lanka. The journey then proceeds to the Japanese Peace Pagoda in Rumassala, and concludes with a brief stop at the Sea Turtle Farm in Galle Mahamodara, further highlighting the region's efforts in sea turtle conservation.

description: Colombo & Negombo To Galle | Hikkaduwa | Mirissa Day Tour
include: Pick up and drop-off at your accommodation in an air-conditioned vehicle
fullDescriptionParas: Begin your day at 8:00 AM at Madu River in Balapitiya for a boat safari. For one-hour, journey through the primitive depths of the mangrove marshes. Traverse the dark and dangerous caverns, formed by the thick mangrove forests, interspersed with stretches of bright open water.

The next destination is the Kothduwa Temple. This Buddhist temple is located on the island and is known as the Kothduwa Raja Maha Viharaya. The island is within the Madu Ganga Estuary. Madu Ganga is an archipelago of fifteen different islands and a lagoon. It is believed that a Relic of Lord Buddha was once sheltered in the Kothduwa temple circa 340CE.

Enjoy lunch then visit the Lunuganga Garden. Geoffrey Bawa was one of Asia's finest architects. He passed away in 2003. Lunuganga was Bawaâ€™s country home. It sits in an enchanting atmosphere with glorious views. It is now managed by the Lunuganga Trust. Admire the homeâ€™s features and blissfulness. It is now run as a country hotel and the proceeds go to Negombo.

description: Day excursion to Diyaluma waterfall from Galle Weligama

experience.heading: Starting location
experience.text: Koggala, Galle, Ahangama, Weligama, Unawatuna, Mirissa

experience.heading: Diyaluma Water Falls
experience.text: Hiking, Scenic views on the way

experience.heading: Arrive back at:
experience.text: Galle, Koggala, Weligama, Ahangama, Mirissa, Unawatuna

fullDescriptionParas: Explore the breathtaking natural wonders of Sri Lanka with our exclusive tour starting from the Galle area. Your adventure begins with a convenient hotel pick-up, ensuring a hassle-free start to your journey

Embark on an unforgettable excursion to witness the majestic Diyaluma Waterfall, boasting a staggering 220-meter cascade. Awe will be instilled in you as you get closer to this breathtaking example of natural beauty and grandeur. Experience the mist on your face as the tumbling waters produce an enchanting scene amidst the verdant surroundings.Discover Sri Lanka's beauty with you hotel pick-up! Marvel at Diyaluma Waterfall's 220m cascade, A day of nature and memories awaits

the chance to decompress and rest amid the wonders of Mother Nature. This tour promises an enriching experience full of wonder and exploration, whether you're a nature enthusiast, adventure seeker, or just looking for a peaceful getaway.Come along for an exciting day filled with exploration, adventure, and life-changing experiences as we travel to one of Sri Lanka's most well-known natural sites. Make your tour reservation right away, and get ready to be mesmerized by Diyaluma Waterfall's splendor.

description: Udawalawe National Park Wildlife Safari from Galle
include: Transportation by air conditioned shared vehicle
Safari drive by Jeep - shared jeep
exclude: Entrance fee to Udawalawe National Park
fullDescriptionParas: Your day will begin with pick-up at Galle. Then, relax on the 1 and half hour drive to Udawalawe National Park, created in the 1970s to provide a sanctuary for wild animals displaced by the construction of the Udawalawe Reservoir on the Walawe River. Udawalawe National Park is a renowned wildlife sanctuary known for its diverse and abundant wildlife, with a special focus on its large elephant population, Now the third most visited park in Sri Lanka. The park's picturesque landscapes encompass lush grasslands, forests, and a scenic reservoir Here, you'll embark on a thrilling jeep safari. Visitors can embark on thrilling jeep safaris led by expert guides to observe elephants, leopards, birds, and other fascinating creatures in their natural habitat. Udawalawe National Park is not only a wildlife haven but also a place of conservation and environmental significance, making it a must-visit destination for nature enthusiasts and wildlife lovers.
